item.title: R: data.table - Finding the maximum row
item.description: In my continued playing around with the R data.table package I wanted to find the maximum row based on one of the columns, grouped by another column, and then return back the whole row. We'll use the following data table to illustrate: > blogDT = data.table(name = c("Property 1","Property 1","Property 1","Property 2","Property 2","Property 2"), price = c(10000, 12500, 18000, 245000, 512000, 1000000), date = c("Day 1", "Day 7", "Day 10", "Day 3", "Day 5", "Day 12")) > blogDT[, lag.
